questions.question: Which specific shell is the most commonly used on Linux and provides an interface for the user to communicate with the kernel?
When a file is created, which command is used to set the default permissions applied to it?
You are editing a file in the Vi editor. Which command will NOT save your changes and quit the editor?
The ls -F command appends indicators to filenames. What indicator is appended to symbolic links?
Which of the following is an example of an absolute pathname?
Which field in the /etc/shadow file specifies the number of days to start warning the user before a required password change?
answers: The minimum days between changes field.
The warning days before expiration field.
questions.correct: The warning days before expiration field.

questions.question: In Vi's Command Mode, which key sequence is used to delete the entire line containing the cursor?
The df command displays information about disk space. What does the df stand for?
What does the metacharacter [] (square brackets) represent in file globbing?
answers: A range of characters for a single character position.
Any sequence of characters including the leading dot.
questions.correct: A range of characters for a single character position.

questions.question: Which command is used to display the user's UID, GID, and groups?
Which command option for tail will display the ending lines of a file, starting the output from the 20th line?
What is the name of the operating system component that provides an interface for the user to communicate with the kernel by parsing commands?
You want to redirect standard output to a file named results.txt without deleting the file's existing content. Which operator should you use?
What is the default termination signal sent to a process when using the kill command without specifying a signal number?
Which command is used to install packages from a single *.rpm file?
What is the purpose of the init 0 command?
answers: To switch to the graphical environment.
To change the system runlevel to multi-user mode.

questions.question: Which Linux component loads into RAM when the machine boots and remains resident until the machine powers off?
You execute the command chmod u+x,go+r file1. What does the go+r segment of the command do?
answers: Grants execute permission to the Group and Other.
Grants read permission to the Group and Other.
Grants read permission to the Group only.
Grants read and execute permissions to the Group and Other.
questions.correct: Grants read permission to the Group and Other.

questions.question: What is the default mode when the Vi editor starts up?
You want to change the login name of an existing user named oldname to newname. Which command should you use?
Which command is used to display the total sum of space allocated to all files rooted in a specified directory?
Which environment variable holds the complete path of the currently logged-in user's home directory?
What is the output of the command ls -l fruit? if the files present in the directory are fruit1, fruit2, fruit_a, and fruits?
Which field in the /etc/passwd file determines the user's primary login shell?
What information does the Inode Table store about a file?
answers: The file's type, permissions, and physical location on the media.
The file's full path on the filesystem.
questions.correct: The file's type, permissions, and physical location on the media.

questions.question: Which command is used to view the list of commands that are currently set as shortcuts in the shell?
Which of the following is an example of a FOSS license explicitly mentioned in the document?
What is the purpose of the kill signal number 9 (SIGKILL)?
answers: Immediate process termination that cannot be ignored.
Asking a process to reload its configuration.
questions.correct: Immediate process termination that cannot be ignored.

questions.question: Which command is used to display the currently logged-in user name and ID?
The ls -a command lists all files, including hidden files. What character must a file start with to be considered a hidden file in Linux?
What is the purpose of the tar option c?
answers: To extract files from an archive.
To specify the archive file name.
To create a new archive file.
To list the table of contents.
questions.correct: To create a new archive file.

questions.question: Which command is used to switch to another user account?
Which shell initialization file is executed by the DisplayManager (GUI session) and the login shell (textual console)?
You execute a command that takes too long to execute. Which key sequence can you use to interrupt the command?
What is the purpose of the grep -i option?
answers: To list the file name only.
To ignore case when searching for the pattern.
To search for a complete word only.
questions.correct: To ignore case when searching for the pattern.

questions.question: When using mv (move) on the same filesystem, how does the system typically handle the file operation?
answers: Allocates a new inode number and copies the data.
Creates a new directory entry referencing the original inode and deletes the old entry.
Moves the file's data to a new disk block.
Creates a soft link to the original location.
questions.correct: Creates a new directory entry referencing the original inode and deletes the old entry.

questions.question: Which utility is used to define group members, group administrators, and change group passwords?
When setting permissions using the octal (numeric) mode, what value represents the Execute permission?
Which command is used to search the live filesystem for files, providing current data but causing more system load than locate?
Which ls option is used to recursively list the contents of subdirectories?
Which section of a manual page includes information about known errors?
What is the full form of the yum package management utility?
You are searching for a string in a file using Vi's Command Mode and type /search_term. Which key will find the next occurrence of the search term?
To create a directory named project/src/include, where both project and src do not yet exist, which command must be used?
What is the command to repeat the last command executed in the bash shell?
Which command is used to display lines of input that match a specified regular expression pattern?
Which type of link creates a new directory entry that points directly to the exact same inode as the original file, and cannot cross partition boundaries?
Which option for the chown command is used to change only the group owner of file1 to group1?
What is the numerical value for Standard Input (stdin)?
Which command is used to change the minimum number of days between password changes for a user?
To get help about a command that is often built into the command itself, which option is commonly used?
What happens when you use [Ctrl]-d on a command that expects input from the keyboard but hasn't received an argument?
answers: The last executed command is repeated.
The process is sent to the background.

questions.question: Which command option must be used with rm to remove a directory and its contents?
Which command is used to switch between groups the user is already a member of?
Which command is used to set the password for a newly created user account?
What is the definition of a Daemon process?
answers: A process that runs in the foreground.
A process that runs in the background and provides services.
The child process created by the parent.
A process with a niceness value of -20.
questions.correct: A process that runs in the background and provides services.

questions.question: Which wc option is used to display the number of characters in a file?
Which command is used to create a new, empty file or update the timestamp of an existing file?
Which file defines user accounts and their properties, such as Home Directory and Login shell?
In octal mode, what permission is represented by the numeric value 4?
You are searching for a string in a file using Vi's Command Mode and type /search_term. Which key will find the next occurrence of the search term?
What does a smaller number (e.g., -20) for the Niceness value mean for a process?
answers: Lower priority, receives less CPU time.
Higher priority, receives more CPU time.
The process is running in the background.
questions.correct: Higher priority, receives more CPU time.

questions.question: Which file is executed whenever a user enters a shell or the desktop environment (Global Shell)?
Which command option for cp prevents the accidental overwriting of existing files?
What is the primary advantage of using yum over rpm for package management?
answers: yum installs packages from source code.
yum cannot be used to remove packages.

questions.question: Which command option for grep is used to search for a complete word instead of a pattern embedded within a word?
What is the purpose of the man -k keyword command?
answers: Searches the live filesystem for the command.
Shows commands that have manual pages containing the given keyword.
Displays the full manual page for the keyword.
questions.correct: Shows commands that have manual pages containing the given keyword.

questions.question: Which utility is used to display a summary of current system activity, including what each user is doing?
Which command is used to define new groups?
What does the output of the ls -F command append to a directory name?
A user executes head -10 file.txt. What will the output display?
answers: The last 10 lines of the file.
The first 10 characters of the file.
The first 10 lines of the file.
The full contents of the file.
questions.correct: The first 10 lines of the file.

questions.question: Which command is used to view processes dynamically and in real-time?
The command find / -name "test*" is executed. What is required around the pattern "test*" for the command to execute as intended?
Which command is used to remove a directory only if it is empty?
Which command is used to display the current working directory (CWD)?
What does the r permission allow a user to do with a directory?
answers: Use the cd command to access it.
Add and delete files within it.
List the directory contents using ls.
questions.correct: List the directory contents using ls.

questions.question: Which Vi Command Mode action is performed by typing w?
answers: Move the cursor to the beginning of the line.
Open a new line below the cursor.

questions.question: The locate command searches for files using a pre-built database. Which command is used to build or update this database?
What is the lowest (highest priority) Niceness value that a standard user can set for a new process using the nice command?
Which command is used to add multiple user accounts listed in a file?
Which command is used to remove a previously set alias?
Which command, when executed by the root user, is used to set the account expiration date?
The tee command writes its standard input simultaneously to the standard output and where else?
What does the metacharacter * (asterisk) represent in file globbing?
answers: 0 or more characters (except the leading dot).
questions.correct: 0 or more characters (except the leading dot).

questions.question: What is the purpose of the sudo command?
answers: To switch user identity to root.
To grant limited root privileges in a more secure way.
questions.correct: To grant limited root privileges in a more secure way.

questions.question: Which command, or combination of commands, would be used to change the owner and group owner of file1 to user1 and group1 respectively?
answers: chown user1 file1 and chgrp group1 file1
Both A and B are correct.

questions.question: Which command is used to search for processes by pattern?
Which command is used to translate characters from standard input to standard output?
Which of the following is NOT a required file extension for a file in Linux?
answers: None, there are no extensions required in Linux.
questions.correct: None, there are no extensions required in Linux.

questions.question: Which file is used to define groups and their members?
What is the range of Niceness values for process scheduling priority?
Which command, when run in Vi's Last Line Mode, ignores case-sensitive searches?
To update an existing package using yum, keeping prior versions (if possible), which command is generally used?
Which file is executed by bash when started as a login shell, but does NOT influence graphical sessions by default?
What is the purpose of the shutdown -h time command?
answers: To halt the system after shutdown.
To send a warning message only.
questions.correct: To halt the system after shutdown.

questions.question: In the command syntax command [options] [arguments], what typically represents the file names or data needed by the command?
Which redirection operator is used to redirect Standard Error to a file?
Which command is used to repeat a command entered n commands back in the history list?
Which historical Unix variant was created by IBM?
What happens to a soft link (symbolic link) if the original file it points to is deleted?
answers: The soft link becomes an 'orphaned link'.
The original file's link count is decremented.
The soft link automatically converts to a hard link.
questions.correct: The soft link becomes an 'orphaned link'.

questions.question: Which Vi Command Mode command is used to insert text at the end of the current line?
Which command is used to find all files owned by groups not defined in the /etc/group file?
Which command is used to delete a user's password to force a required change on next login?
Which command views the contents of all environment variables?
What happens if a user who is neither the owner nor a group member tries to access a file? (Hint: The most specific permissions apply.)
Which utility is used to display a summary of current system activity, including what each user is doing?
Which command option for `rm` will prompt the user before removing each file?
Which utility is mandatory for editing the /etc/sudoers file because it includes a syntax checker?
In Vi's Command Mode, which key sequence is used to delete from the cursor to the right end of the line?
If the source and destination are on the same filesystem, what does the mv command primarily manipulate?
Which rpm option is used to upgrade a package, removing the old version?
Which command option for `wc` is used to count the number of words?
What is the purpose of the `chown user1:group1 file1` command?
Which command is used to display the login name, login device (tty), and login date/time for users currently on the system?
Which type of pathname starts from the root directory (/)?
